forum.name: updates
forum.description: find out what's new with anylad. feature announcements and bug fix info. thanks all!
forum.latestCommentText: im gonna miss it for sure

comments.text: Hi! Version 169.1 (you're on [version]) has newly reworked dynamic hands.
This time, the hand doesn't move when triggering.
Feedback welcome! Thx all!
And v169.3: There's no more length limit for the part scripts Find & Replace function (at the back of the part Copy & Paste dialog) & web screen inputs! Thx Frank & Rusty!
You can now also disable scripts (in areas where you're editor) via Features file's new "scriptsAsEditor", if you ever find yourself crashing right in your home! Thx Zid!
why don't you just keep the first grip without moving the hand or ring? also, why can we not turn it off again?
could you pls explain what you mean by your first question? as far as a toggle goes, it depends on all of your feedback, we can add one back in if needed. so, feedback welcome!
the first gripping animation has a lot of movement, but also moved the hand altogether, as well as the ring. my suggestion was to have that animation (or a simple fist form)-
-without the hand or ring moving whatsoever. if you want though, i can discuss my thoughts ingame (excluding the boards, of course)
also, please leave the dot always visible like before.
i think i understand, thx! basically, with a full tweeze as before, the tweeze focus (where the dot ought to be) is shifted much lower. we tried today indeed to move it there, ...
... but it confused the touch dot and overall handling if there's two positions (and we need to keep the button touch dot on the finger tip). a bit hard to explain but easy to ...
... feel once you try. thx for the suggestion of keeping the dot when clicked, we'll do some experiments! (in the old version, it became very small when clicked)
oh, right. for the dot, i'd say just leave it there, too. basically the same kind of thing as most custom hands with the static hand from before. from using them for some time,-
-you don't exactly need to keep the finger dot connected to the finger. it also kind of falls into the same problem as the ring (custom hand compatability issues).
right, when you wear a custom hand, the dot shouldn't disappear (it doesn't move, btw)... neither should the ring. we'll fix that!
i know it doesn't move, just thought you might add that, from what you said about it. thanks!
Update 170.1: Now when wearing custom hands, there won't be any dynamic hand effects like a moving ring or disappearing dot! Thx Xau!
hey phillip there is a glitch with my hand to where when i got into anyland after updating the finger dot is invisible. plz fix, thx
cj i have an idea what may happen, looking into a fix, thx!
thanks for the custom update, feels much better for them.
Update 171: We fixed an issue with the hand-dot sometimes disappearing for the session! Thx CJ!
xau, great!
